info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 28 at 12:16AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT CENTRAL BUTLER...CENTRAL ARMSTRONG AND SOUTHWESTERN CLARION COUNTIES... At 1215 AM EST, snow showers were located over Shanor-Northvue, or near Butler, moving east at 30 mph. Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with these snow showers along with rapid reductions in visibility and quick coatings of snow on roadways. Locations impacted include... Butler, Kittanning, Rimersburg, Homeacre-Lyndora, Shanor-Northvue, Meridian, Meadowood, Oak Hills, Prospect, Chicora, East Brady, Parker, East Butler, Worthington, Bruin, West Hills, West Liberty, Petrolia, Karns City, and Fairview. This includes Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 93 and 96. Snow will lead to reduced visibilities and hazardous travel conditions. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
